<link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CLASSICSGRADS;ae33c25a.1503</link>   <description> 6-hour lectureship in Ancient History (fixed term, 2 years) at Trinity College, Oxford:<br>http://www.trinity.ox.ac.uk/vacancies/<br><br>Archive of list messages may be found at:<br>http://www.jiscmail.ac.uk/classicsgrads<br>Visit the same site to change your subscription settings.<br>All queries regarding the list should be directed to:<br>jonathan.prag@merton.ox.ac.uk    </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-11T20:18:41+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Jonathan rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CLASSICSGRADS;a7826d6d.1503">   <title>Lecturership in Classics at Wadham </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CLASSICSGRADS;a7826d6d.1503</link>   <description> WADHAM COLLEGE, OXFORD<br><br>STIPENDIARY LECTURERSHIP IN CLASSICS<br><br>1st September 2015 - 31st August 2016<br><br>The College proposes to appoint a 12-hour Stipendiary Lecturer in Classics for the 2015-2016 academic year (when Stephen Heyworth, Fellow and Tutor in Classics, will be on sabbatical leave).<br><br>Duties and Responsibilities: The lecturer will be required to give an average of twelve hours per week of tutorials during the eight weeks of each full term, and to engage in advanced research. The successful candidate will be able to provide teaching in Greek and Latin language, for at least two of the Classical Mods papers Homer, [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-09T23:23:16+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Jonathan Prag</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CLASSICSGRADS;a7826d6d.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CLASSICSGRADS;a591620e.1502">   <title>Digital Data Reuse Award - Deadline 13th March </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CLASSICSGRADS;a591620e.1502</link>   <description> ***Apologies for cross posting***<br><br>Internet Archaeology (http://intarch.ac.uk) and the Archaeology Data Service (http://archaeologydataservice.ac.uk) have teamed up to provide an Award that recognises the outstanding archaeological research being carried out through the re-use of digital data.<br><br>The Digital Data Re-use Award offers archaeological researchers the chance to promote their work and win the opportunity to publish, free of charge, in the premier open access journal Internet Archaeology. http://archaeologydataservice.ac.uk/blog/2014/10/digital-data-re-use-award/ [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-27T10:38:54+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Archaeology Data Service</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CLASSICSGRADS;a591620e.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CLASSICSGRADS;a8dbc5e4.1502">   <title>Post-doctoral fellowship at Florida State University </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CLASSICSGRADS;a8dbc5e4.1502</link>   <description> With apologies for cross-posting.<br><br>Post-Doctoral Fellow in Classics at Florida State University<br><br>The College of Arts and Sciences at Florida State University has inaugurated a Post-Doctoral Fellows program in the Humanities, and the Department of Classics has been awarded one of the first such Fellow positions. This position is a two-year appointment to begin August 2015, of nine months for each of the two academic years, non-renewable. In addition to engagement with the undergraduate and graduate students and participation in the research program of the Department, the duties of the position shall include a teaching load of 2 courses each [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-11T08:50:58+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Jonathan Prag</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CLASSICSGRADS;a8dbc5e4.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CLASSICSGRADS;3e44ae1f.1502">   <title>Methodologies in Ancient Material Culture - CFP </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CLASSICSGRADS;3e44ae1f.1502</link>   <description> With apologies for cross-posting<br><br>Call for Papers<br><br>Conference on Methodologies in Ancient Material Culture<br><br>University of Winnipeg, Canada<br><br>Oct. 2-4, 2015<br><br>In recent decades there has been a dramatic shift in studies of ancient material culture away from the long-established avenues of scholarship that prioritised the identification of objects by renowned ancient artists towards a contextualised assessment of the ancient record. The function of antiquities, their context and their interpretation as part of a wider assemblage of material is now a focus of attention. This conference will explore the different aspects of these issues, and the confirmed keynote speaker will [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-07T12:05:28+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Jonathan Prag</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CLASSICSGRADS;3e44ae1f.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CLASSICSGRADS;b793ae35.1502">   <title>CFP: In search of the origins of religions - Ghent 11-13 September 2015 </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CLASSICSGRADS;b793ae35.1502</link>   <description> Call for papers.<br><br>International Conference of the Belgian Association for<br>the Study of Religions<br><br>IN SEARCH OF THE ORIGINS OF RELIGIONS<br><br>\ufffd\ufffd \ufffd\ufffd Ghent 11-13 September 2015<br><br>\ufffd\ufffd This conference (in Ghent) will analyze factors that contributed to the<br>\ufffd\ufffd origins of religion as such, the origins of a specific religion and of a<br>\ufffd\ufffd specific tradition within a religion. It also includes the beginnings of<br>\ufffd\ufffd the scientific study of religion. The geographical scope is global and<br>\ufffd\ufffd papers can be submitted on any historical period. The aim of the<br>conference is both to give the floor to international [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-03T17:01:22+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Annelies Lannoy</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CLASSICSGRADS;b793ae35.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CLASSICSGRADS;ad3b83fd.1502">   <title>Postdoctoral fellowship in quantitative archaeology (Barcelona) </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CLASSICSGRADS;ad3b83fd.1502</link>   <description> EPNet is an ERC Advanced Grant research project (03/2015 - 02/2020)<br>that aims at studying the political and economic dynamics of the Roman<br>Empire food production and trade system by exploring different<br>historical hypotheses through computer modeling and simulations.<br><br>The project is offering a Postdoctoral fellowship for a researcher who<br>will be involved in the following activities:<br>- Development of quantitative analysis for Roman amphora epigraphy distribution.<br>- Design of models and computer simulation on roman trade.<br>- Interdisciplinary cross-fertilization and knowledge exchange. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-03T11:18:40+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Xavier Rubio</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CLASSICSGRADS;ad3b83fd.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CLASSICSGRADS;e5fb056d.1502">   <title>FW: Australia -- Roman-history lectureship. </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CLASSICSGRADS;e5fb056d.1502</link>   <description> ROMAN-HISTORY LECTURESHIP -AUSTRALIA<br><br>The University of Queensland, which is located in Brisbane, Australia, seeks to appoint a Lecturer in Classics and Ancient History. This is a full-time position for fixed term of 2.5 years. The lecturer will be required to teach mainstream Roman history and Latin at all levels. The total remuneration per year is up to AUD120,671 (approx. GBP62,327 or EURO82,768). To discuss the role please contact the Head of School, Assoc. Prof. Martin Crotty (m.crotty@uq.edu.au<mailto:m.crotty@uq.edu.au>), or the Convenor of Classics and Ancient History, Prof. Alastair Blanshard (a.blanshard@uq.edu.au<mailto:a.blanshard@uq.edu.au>). The closing date for applications is 1 March 2015. For further [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-02T22:45:49+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Jonathan Prag</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CLASSICSGRADS;e5fb056d.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CLASSICSGRADS;a2211112.1502">   <title>Digital Classicist London 2015 CFP </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CLASSICSGRADS;a2211112.1502</link>   <description> The Digital Classicist London seminars provide a forum for research into the ancient world that employs innovative digital and interdisciplinary methods. The seminars are held on Friday afternoons from June to mid-August in the Institute of Classical Studies, Senate House, London, WC1E 7HU.<br><br>We are seeking contributions from students as well as established researchers and practitioners. We welcome papers discussing individual projects and their immediate contexts, but also wish to accommodate the broader theoretical considerations of the use of digital methods in the study of the ancient world, including ancient cultures beyond the classical Mediterranean. You should expect a mixed [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-02T17:49:41+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Tupman, Charlotte</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CLASSICSGRADS;a2211112.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CLASSICSGRADS;c213084c.1501">   <title>FW: AH lectureship, Cambridge </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CLASSICSGRADS;c213084c.1501</link>   <description> UNIVERSITY OF CAMBRIDGE<br>Temporary Lectureship in Classics (Ancient History)<br>Reference no. GE05213<br><br>Salary on appointment: \ufffd\ufffd38,511 - \ufffd\ufffd48,743<br><br>The Faculty of Classics is seeking to appoint a Temporary Lectureship in Classics (Ancient History) from 01 October 2015 until 30 September 2017. This post, which will cover the award of a Leverhulme Trust Senior Research Fellowship to Professor Mary Beard, is a fixed-term appointment for two years which is open to those, at any stage in their career, with a primary research interest in any area of Roman history. The successful candidate will have a record of world-class research commensurate with [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-31T17:20:10+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Jonathan Prag</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CLASSICSGRADS;c213084c.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CLASSICSGRADS;22fdc9a5.1501">   <title>CALL FOR PAPERS - Greek diet, health, and medicine in the Roman world </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CLASSICSGRADS;22fdc9a5.1501</link>   <description> CALL FOR PAPERS<br><br>Greek diet, health, and medicine in the Roman world:<br>Integration and analysis of the archaeological and literary material<br><br>September 9-11, 2015<br>University of Exeter, Devon, UK<br><br>An international conference organised and funded through the Leventis Initiative on the Impact of Greek Culture.<br><br>Concepts and attitudes towards diet, health, and medicine in the Roman world were heavily influenced by Greek beliefs and practices. Later Greek and Roman medical writers such as Galen built upon a Greek foundation and followed existing traditions. Yet did Greek concepts of health and medicine spread to all regions of the Roman Empire? [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-28T10:31:55+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Rowan, Erica</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CLASSICSGRADS;22fdc9a5.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CLASSICSGRADS;31c5f4a2.1501">   <title>FW: Digital Classicist London 2015 CFP </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CLASSICSGRADS;31c5f4a2.1501</link>   <description> The Digital Classicist London seminars provide a forum for research into the ancient world that employs innovative digital and interdisciplinary methods. The seminars are held on Friday afternoons from June to mid-August in the Institute of Classical Studies, Senate House, London, WC1E 7HU.<br><br>We are seeking contributions from students as well as established researchers and practitioners. We welcome papers discussing individual projects and their immediate contexts, but also wish to accommodate the broader theoretical considerations of the use of digital methods in the study of the ancient world, including ancient cultures beyond the classical Mediterranean. You should expect a mixed [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-21T16:36:58+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Jonathan Prag</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CLASSICSGRADS;31c5f4a2.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CLASSICSGRADS;c0d50fbb.1501">   <title>Fwd: UK Doctoral Theses In Progress </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CLASSICSGRADS;c0d50fbb.1501</link>   <description> UK Doctoral Theses In Progress<br><br>The Institute of Classical Studies is pleased to announce the publication on its website of a database of UK Doctoral Theses at http://www.icls.sas.ac.uk/students/uk-doctoral-theses. The database is designed to provide up-to-date information on current doctoral research in the field of Classics, as broadly defined, and to act as a permanent record of theses as they are completed. The database is searchable by keyword, area of study, department, University or date of commencement or expected completion. A complete list of theses may also be viewed. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-20T22:22:54+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Jonathan Prag</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CLASSICSGRADS;c0d50fbb.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item Summer School: http://www.bsa.ac.uk/index.php?<br>option=com_content&amp;view=article&amp;id=5&amp;Itemid=103<br><br>Postgraduate Epigraphy Course: http://www.bsa.ac.uk/index.php?<br>option=com_content&amp;view=article&amp;id=10&amp;Itemid=109<br><br>Postgraduate Greek and Roman Pottery http://www.bsa.ac.uk/index.php?<br>option=com_content&amp;view=article&amp;id=12&amp;Itemid=111<br><br>With Best Wishes,<br>Chryssanthi Papadopoulou<br><br>Archive of list messages may be found at:<br>http://www.jiscmail.ac.uk/classicsgrads<br>Visit the same site to change your subscription settings.<br>All queries regarding the list should be directed to:<br>jonathan.prag@merton.ox.ac.uk <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CLASSICSGRADS;71dd052f.1412</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CLASSICSGRADS;4272510c.1412">   <title>British School at Athens Greek Epigraphy Course </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CLASSICSGRADS;4272510c.1412</link>   <description> THE BRITISH SCHOOL AT ATHENS<br><br>POSTGRADUATE TRAINING COURSE IN GREEK EPIGRAPHY<br>7th \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd 20th June 2015<br><br>Whether publishing new inscriptions, reinterpreting old ones, or critically analysing editions, this course provides training for historians, archaeologists and textual scholars alike in the discipline of reading and interpreting epigraphic evidence. Students will be guided through the process of producing editions of inscriptions, gaining practical first hand experience with the stones as well as instruction in editorial and bibliographic skills. Guest lectures on historical and thematic subjects will explore the ways in which epigraphic evidence can inform a wide range of Classical subjects. The [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-12-15T10:01:14+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Jonathan Prag</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CLASSICSGRADS;4272510c.1412</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CLASSICSGRADS;75d5541e.1412">   <title>ENS de Paris </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CLASSICSGRADS;75d5541e.1412</link>   <description> To which now add the ENS, Paris programme (with thanks to Anca Dan)<br>http://www.ens.fr/admission/selection-internationale?lang=en<br><br>Archive of list messages may be found at:<br>http://www.jiscmail.ac.uk/classicsgrads<br>Visit the same site to change your subscription settings.<br>All queries regarding the list should be directed to:<br>jonatha   </description>   <dc:date>2014-12-11T09:17:03+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Jonathan Prag</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CLASSICSGRADS;75d5541e.1412</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CLASSICSGRADS;b0e19b64.1412">   <title>FW: Scholarships ENS de Lyon </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CLASSICSGRADS;b0e19b64.1412</link>   <description> The ENS de Lyon and its partners offer scholarships for international students to enrol in its Masters programs in the Exact Sciences, the Arts, and Human and Social Sciences.<br><br>The maximum financial support is 1,000 Euros per month for twelve months.<br><br>Students from all countries are eligible.<br><br>Further information and the application form can be found on our website:<br>www.ens-lyon.eu&gt; International&gt; Scholarships [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-12-11T08:40:29+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Jonathan Prag</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CLASSICSGRADS;b0e19b64.1412</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CLASSICSGRADS;309d3aeb.1412">   <title>CONFERENCE ON THE RECEPTION OF ANCIENT GREEK TRAGEDY - REMINDER </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CLASSICSGRADS;309d3aeb.1412</link>   <description> INTERNATIONALCONFERENCE ON THE RECEPTION OF ANCIENT GREEK TRAGIC MYTH INMODERN GREEK POETRY AND THEATRE OF THE 2OTH AND 21ST CENTURIES<br><br>\ufffd\ufffd<br>21-22December 2014<br><br>\ufffd\ufffd<br>VENUE: Holiday Inn, 70 Rigenis Street,Nicosia, Cyprus<br><br>\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd<br><br>REGISTRATION\ufffd\ufffdIS FREE BUT REQUIRED. It is located in an elegant 18th c. villa in a park with views of what is generally mistaken for Mont Blanc, and the accommodation has undergone extensive and very successful modernisation. It has an excellent and beautiful library, particularly strong in texts and commentaries, and provides a peaceful environment for a period of uninterrupted research and writing.
